title: West Ham place steward directly in front of Dimitri Payet mural to prevent vandals from defacing it
text:
Sport West Ham place steward directly in front of Dimitri Payet mural to prevent vandals from defacing it The Frenchman is public enemy No 1 at West Ham after making it clear to Slaven Bilic that he wants to leave Share A steward guards the Dimitri Payet of West Ham United sign outside the stadium (Photo: Getty Images)   Thank you for subscribing!   
West Ham may no longer want Dimitri Payet, but at the same time they don't want their new ground to be targeted by vandals. 
With that in mind, the Hammers made the decision to locate a steward directly in front of Payet's mural at the Olympic Stadium ahead of their Premier League clash with Crystal Palace. 
The Frenchman is public enemy No 1 at West Ham after making it clear to Slaven Bilic that he wants out of the under-performing east London club. 
Payet began the season as a West Ham hero after a fine 2015-16 campaign, but he now wants to leave amid interest from former club Marseille. 
Hammers officials are clearly worried that vandals could deface the Payet mural at the stadium as a steward was spotted watching over it earlier on Saturday.
